speaker: ADRIAN
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: ADRIAN
text_entry: SCENE I. Before PROSPERO'S cell.

speaker: ADRIAN
text_entry: Enter PROSPERO, FERDINAND, and MIRANDA

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If I have too austerely punish'd you,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Your compensation makes amends, for I

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Have given you here a third of mine own life,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Or that for which I live; who once again

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I tender to thy hand: all thy vexations

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Were but my trials of thy love and thou

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hast strangely stood the test here, afore Heaven,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I ratify this my rich gift. O Ferdinand,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Do not smile at me that I boast her off,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For thou shalt find she will outstrip all praise

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And make it halt behind her.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I do believe it

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Against an oracle.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Then, as my gift and thine own acquisition

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Worthily purchased take my daughter: but

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If thou dost break her virgin-knot before

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: All sanctimonious ceremonies may

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With full and holy rite be minister'd,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No sweet aspersion shall the heavens let fall

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To make this contract grow: but barren hate,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sour-eyed disdain and discord shall bestrew

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The union of your bed with weeds so loathly

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That you shall hate it both: therefore take heed,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As Hymen's lamps shall light you.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: As I hope

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: For quiet days, fair issue and long life,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: With such love as 'tis now, the murkiest den,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The most opportune place, the strong'st suggestion.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Our worser genius can, shall never melt

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Mine honour into lust, to take away

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The edge of that day's celebration

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: When I shall think: or Phoebus' steeds are founder'd,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Or Night kept chain'd below.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fairly spoke.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sit then and talk with her; she is thine own.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What, Ariel! my industrious servant, Ariel!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter ARIEL

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: What would my potent master? here I am.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou and thy meaner fellows your last service

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Did worthily perform; and I must use you

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In such another trick. Go bring the rabble,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: O'er whom I give thee power, here to this place:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Incite them to quick motion; for I must

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Bestow upon the eyes of this young couple

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Some vanity of mine art: it is my promise,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And they expect it from me.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Presently?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Ay, with a twink.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Before you can say 'come' and 'go,'

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And breathe twice and cry 'so, so,'

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Each one, tripping on his toe,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Will be here with mop and mow.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Do you love me, master? no?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Dearly my delicate Ariel. Do not approach

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Till thou dost hear me call.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Well, I conceive.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Look thou be true; do not give dalliance

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Too much the rein: the strongest oaths are straw

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To the fire i' the blood: be more abstemious,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Or else, good night your vow!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I warrant you sir;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The white cold virgin snow upon my heart

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Abates the ardour of my liver.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Well.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Now come, my Ariel! bring a corollary,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Rather than want a spirit: appear and pertly!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No tongue! all eyes! be silent.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Soft music

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter IRIS

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Ceres, most bounteous lady, thy rich leas

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Of wheat, rye, barley, vetches, oats and pease;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Thy turfy mountains, where live nibbling sheep,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: And flat meads thatch'd with stover, them to keep;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Thy banks with pioned and twilled brims,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Which spongy April at thy hest betrims,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: To make cold nymphs chaste crowns; and thy broom -groves,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Whose shadow the dismissed bachelor loves,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Being lass-lorn: thy pole-clipt vineyard;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: And thy sea-marge, sterile and rocky-hard,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Where thou thyself dost air;--the queen o' the sky,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Whose watery arch and messenger am I,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Bids thee leave these, and with her sovereign grace,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Here on this grass-plot, in this very place,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: To come and sport: her peacocks fly amain:

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Approach, rich Ceres, her to entertain.

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Enter CERES

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Hail, many-colour'd messenger, that ne'er

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Dost disobey the wife of Jupiter;

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Who with thy saffron wings upon my flowers

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Diffusest honey-drops, refreshing showers,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: And with each end of thy blue bow dost crown

speaker: CERES
text_entry: My bosky acres and my unshrubb'd down,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Rich scarf to my proud earth; why hath thy queen

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Summon'd me hither, to this short-grass'd green?

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: A contract of true love to celebrate;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: And some donation freely to estate

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: On the blest lovers.

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Tell me, heavenly bow,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: If Venus or her son, as thou dost know,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Do now attend the queen? Since they did plot

speaker: CERES
text_entry: The means that dusky Dis my daughter got,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Her and her blind boy's scandal'd company

speaker: CERES
text_entry: I have forsworn.

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Of her society

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Be not afraid: I met her deity

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Cutting the clouds towards Paphos and her son

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Dove-drawn with her. Here thought they to have done

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Some wanton charm upon this man and maid,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Whose vows are, that no bed-right shall be paid

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Till Hymen's torch be lighted: but vain;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Mars's hot minion is returned again;

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Her waspish-headed son has broke his arrows,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Swears he will shoot no more but play with sparrows

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: And be a boy right out.

speaker: CERES
text_entry: High'st queen of state,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Great Juno, comes; I know her by her gait.

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Enter JUNO

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: How does my bounteous sister? Go with me

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: To bless this twain, that they may prosperous be

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: And honour'd in their issue.

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: They sing:

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: Honour, riches, marriage-blessing,

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: Long continuance, and increasing,

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: Hourly joys be still upon you!

speaker: JUNO
text_entry: Juno sings her blessings upon you.

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Earth's increase, foison plenty,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Barns and garners never empty,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Vines and clustering bunches growing,

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Plants with goodly burthen bowing;

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Spring come to you at the farthest

speaker: CERES
text_entry: In the very end of harvest!

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Scarcity and want shall shun you;

speaker: CERES
text_entry: Ceres' blessing so is on you.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: This is a most majestic vision, and

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Harmoniously charmingly. May I be bold

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To think these spirits?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Spirits, which by mine art

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I have from their confines call'd to enact

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My present fancies.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Let me live here ever;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: So rare a wonder'd father and a wife

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Makes this place Paradise.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Juno and Ceres whisper, and send Iris on employment

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sweet, now, silence!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Juno and Ceres whisper seriously;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: There's something else to do: hush, and be mute,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Or else our spell is marr'd.

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: You nymphs, call'd Naiads, of the windring brooks,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: With your sedged crowns and ever-harmless looks,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Leave your crisp channels and on this green land

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Answer your summons; Juno does command:

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Come, temperate nymphs, and help to celebrate

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: A contract of true love; be not too late.

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Enter certain Nymphs

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: You sunburnt sicklemen, of August weary,

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Come hither from the furrow and be merry:

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Make holiday; your rye-straw hats put on

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: And these fresh nymphs encounter every one

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: In country footing.

speaker: IRIS
text_entry: Enter certain Reapers, properly habited: they  join with the Nymphs in a graceful dance;  towards the end whereof PROSPERO starts  suddenly, and speaks; after which, to a  strange, hollow, and confused noise, they heavily vanish

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: [Aside]  I had forgot that foul conspiracy

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of the beast Caliban and his confederates

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Against my life: the minute of their plot

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Is almost come.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To the Spirits

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Well done! avoid; no more!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: This is strange: your father's in some passion

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That works him strongly.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Never till this day

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Saw I him touch'd with anger so distemper'd.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: You do look, my son, in a moved sort,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As if you were dismay'd: be cheerful, sir.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Our revels now are ended. These our actors,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As I foretold you, were all spirits and

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Are melted into air, into thin air:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And, like the baseless fabric of this vision,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The cloud-capp'd towers, the gorgeous palaces,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The solemn temples, the great globe itself,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Ye all which it inherit, shall dissolve

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And, like this insubstantial pageant faded,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Leave not a rack behind. We are such stuff

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As dreams are made on, and our little life

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Is rounded with a sleep. Sir, I am vex'd;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Bear with my weakness; my, brain is troubled:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Be not disturb'd with my infirmity:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If you be pleased, retire into my cell

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And there repose: a turn or two I'll walk,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To still my beating mind.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: We wish your peace.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come with a thought I thank thee, Ariel: come.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter ARIEL

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Thy thoughts I cleave to. What's thy pleasure?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Spirit,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: We must prepare to meet with Caliban.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Ay, my commander: when I presented Ceres,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I thought to have told thee of it, but I fear'd

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Lest I might anger thee.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Say again, where didst thou leave these varlets?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I told you, sir, they were red-hot with drinking;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: So fun of valour that they smote the air

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: For breathing in their faces; beat the ground

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: For kissing of their feet; yet always bending

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Towards their project. Then I beat my tabour;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: At which, like unback'd colts, they prick'd

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: their ears,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Advanced their eyelids, lifted up their noses

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: As they smelt music: so I charm'd their ears

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: That calf-like they my lowing follow'd through

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Tooth'd briers, sharp furzes, pricking goss and thorns,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Which entered their frail shins: at last I left them

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I' the filthy-mantled pool beyond your cell,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: There dancing up to the chins, that the foul lake

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: O'erstunk their feet.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: This was well done, my bird.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thy shape invisible retain thou still:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The trumpery in my house, go bring it hither,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For stale to catch these thieves.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I go, I go.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A devil, a born devil, on whose nature

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Nurture can never stick; on whom my pains,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Humanely taken, all, all lost, quite lost;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And as with age his body uglier grows,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: So his mind cankers. I will plague them all,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Even to roaring.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Re-enter ARIEL, loaden with glistering apparel,  and c

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come, hang them on this line.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: PROSPERO and ARIEL remain invisible. Enter CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO, all wet

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Pray you, tread softly, that the blind mole may not

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Hear a foot fall: we now are near his cell.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Monster, your fairy, which you say is

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: a harmless fairy, has done little better than

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: played the Jack with us.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Monster, I do smell all horse-piss; at

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: which my nose is in great indignation.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: So is mine. Do you hear, monster? If I should take

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: a displeasure against you, look you,--

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Thou wert but a lost monster.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Good my lord, give me thy favour still.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Be patient, for the prize I'll bring thee to

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Shall hoodwink this mischance: therefore speak softly.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: All's hush'd as midnight yet.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Ay, but to lose our bottles in the pool,--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: There is not only disgrace and dishonour in that,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: monster, but an infinite loss.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: That's more to me than my wetting: yet this is your

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: harmless fairy, monster.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I will fetch off my bottle, though I be o'er ears

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: for my labour.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Prithee, my king, be quiet. Seest thou here,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: This is the mouth o' the cell: no noise, and enter.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do that good mischief which may make this island

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thine own for ever, and I, thy Caliban,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For aye thy foot-licker.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Give me thy hand. I do begin to have bloody thoughts.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O king Stephano! O peer! O worthy Stephano! look

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: what a wardrobe here is for thee!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Let it alone, thou fool; it is but trash.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O, ho, monster! we know what belongs to a frippery.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O king Stephano!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Put off that gown, Trinculo; by this hand, I'll have

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: that gown.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Thy grace shall have it.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The dropsy drown this fool I what do you mean

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To dote thus on such luggage? Let's alone

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And do the murder first: if he awake,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: From toe to crown he'll fill our skins with pinches,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Make us strange stuff.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Be you quiet, monster. Mistress line,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: is not this my jerkin? Now is the jerkin under

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: the line: now, jerkin, you are like to lose your

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: hair and prove a bald jerkin.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Do, do: we steal by line and level, an't like your grace.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I thank thee for that jest; here's a garment for't:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: wit shall not go unrewarded while I am king of this

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: country. 'Steal by line and level' is an excellent

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: pass of pate; there's another garment for't.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Monster, come, put some lime upon your fingers, and

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: away with the rest.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I will have none on't: we shall lose our time,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And all be turn'd to barnacles, or to apes

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: With foreheads villanous low.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Monster, lay-to your fingers: help to bear this

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: away where my hogshead of wine is, or I'll turn you

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: out of my kingdom: go to, carry this.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: And this.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Ay, and this.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: A noise of hunters heard. Enter divers Spirits,  in shape of dogs and hounds, and hunt them about, PROSPERO and ARIEL setting them on

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hey, Mountain, hey!

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Silver I there it goes, Silver!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fury, Fury! there, Tyrant, there! hark! hark!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO, are driven out

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Go charge my goblins that they grind their joints

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With dry convulsions, shorten up their sinews

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With aged cramps, and more pinch-spotted make them

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Than pard or cat o' mountain.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Hark, they roar!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Let them be hunted soundly. At this hour

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Lie at my mercy all mine enemies:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Shortly shall all my labours end, and thou

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Shalt have the air at freedom: for a little

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Follow, and do me service.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exeunt
